content:
Congratulations on your new apartment! Furnishing it on a budget can be a challenge, but there are many ways to find affordable and stylish pieces. Here are some suggestions:

1. **Online Marketplaces**:
	* IKEA (ikea.com): Affordable, modern furniture with a wide range of options.
	* Amazon (amazon.com): Check out Amazon Warehouse Deals, Outlet, and used sections for discounted prices.
	* eBay (ebay.com): Find second-hand or new items at discounted prices.
	* Craigslist (craigslist.org) or Facebook Marketplace (facebook.com/marketplace): Local online marketplaces for second-hand items (be cautious when transacting with strangers).
2. **Discount Stores**:
	* Target (target.com): Affordable, trendy pieces with frequent sales.
	* TJ Maxx (tjmaxx.com), Marshalls (marshalls.com), and HomeGoods (homegoods.com): Discounted prices on brand-name items.
	* At Home (athome.com): A discount home decor superstore with a wide selection.
3. **Thrift Stores and Consignment Shops**:
	* Goodwill (goodwill.org), Salvation Army (salvationarmy.org), and local charity shops: Find unique, gently used items at low prices.
	* Consignment shops: Sell or trade gently used items, often at a lower cost than buying new.
4. **Garage Sales and Estate Sales**:
	* Keep an eye out for local garage sales and estate sales, where you can find great deals on gently used items.
5. **Clearance Sections**:
	* Check the clearance sections of local home decor stores, like Bed Bath & Beyond (bedbathandbeyond.com) or Pier 1 Imports (pier1.com), for discounted prices on discontinued or floor models.
6. **DIY and Upcycle**:
	* Get creative and repurpose items you already have or find at thrift stores to save money and add a personal touch.
7. **Second-Hand Online Communities**:
	* Join local online groups, like Buy Nothing or Freecycle, where people give away items they no longer need.
8. **Discount Codes and Coupons**:
	* Sign up for newsletters and follow your favorite home decor stores on social media to receive exclusive discounts and promo codes.
	* Use coupon apps like RetailMeNot (retailmenot.com) or Coupons.com (coupons.com) to find discounts.

As for your experience with the Giant Eagle app, that's great to hear! Online grocery shopping with in-store pickup can be a huge time-saver. You can also try other grocery delivery or pickup services, like Instacart (instacart.com) or Shipt (shipt.com), which often offer promotions and discounts.

Remember to always measure your space and plan your decor before making a purchase, and don't be afraid to mix and match items from different sources to create a unique, stylish look on a budget!
